title: Test the Store
description: Dwight and his team get ready for the grand opening of the Sabre Store, while Andy makes Toby teach self-defense to the Scranton branch employees after he is beat up in the parking lot by a girl.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Today is the test launch day for the inaugural Sabre store. Brr brr brr BRR [imitating trumpet] and I, Dwight Schrute, am in charge of the entire operation. If I can prove myself today and the store is a hit with the media and Nellie sees this, the vice presidency is mine.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Are you holding this chair?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: 'cause I feel like I'm gonna fall off.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes. Yes.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I'm not wearing the right shoes for this.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: We went over this, ok? Your tiny fingers make the best knots.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Hey Strangers. So stoked for the Sabre store opening.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Hey, my name's Tabitha. I'm camped out in front of the Sabre store so I can be first in line for the new Pyramid. Psst. It's me Erin. Dwight had me pretend to be a hipster to create hype, and it's working. There's already people camped out behind me.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Test launch day, people. Now, I would like to fill you in on a little secret about me to inspire you today. Now, I know you probably all think I'm this patrician goddess. But here's the truth. I was born in the little working class town of Basildon, and until the age of 32, [cockney accent] I talked like this, which was bloody horrendous, innit? I came from dirt, no lower than ... what's lower than dirt?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Loam, magma, mantle, outer core, inner core.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Yeah, thank you. Loam. Bloody loam, I came from. I hit rock bottom when I auditioned for the Spice Girls. I didn't even get a callback.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Which Spice Girl?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: The black one. I never stood a chance.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Now, think about my journey here today, and let it inspire your journey.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay. Nellie, thank you. Thank you so much.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Yep

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Today is press day and press is gonna make or break this store. And for a tech company, press can only mean one thing - bloggers. Dossier on bloggers. Bloggers are gross. Bloggers are obese. Bloggers have halitosis. You're gonna love 'em. Ryan is going to be the main event today. He is the pitchman who is going to give the feisty yet profound speech worthy of a world's fair. Ryan, you ready to do this?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: When people see this presentation, they're gonna [bleep] in their pants.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Come on, man.

quotes.speaker: Cathy
quotes.text: Seriously disgusting.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Cathy, you will be the hot girl who talks to bloggers.

quotes.speaker: Cathy
quotes.text: Ugh. Kill me. That was my idea.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Packer, you will be the sexual predator who has come to prey on the trendy teenage girls who are obsessed with the Pyramid.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Uh...

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Uh... that is excellent.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: I don't see what that gets us, but I'm a team player.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Perfect casting, right?

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Schrute's out to get me. But I'm playing the long game. As soon as he messes up, I swoop in like a sexual predator.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: I want to create a sense of wonder and enthusiasm as if, at the end of E.T., candy poured out of the screen. Do you understand? I wanna get goose pimples.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Speaking of pimples, let's release the BLOGGERS!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Morning, everyone.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh, Andy, guess what happened to me this morning?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Don't care. Tell me later.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Listen, it's important. You've gotta hear this.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What do you got?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh, my god!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Do you have a black eye?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yes, I do. Phyllis.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I woke up at 4 am by accident in time for the paper to be delivered. Guess what?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: It's not a kid on a bike. It's a man in a car.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Andy, who punched you?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Hey, I was on the can. What's this about a black guy in the office?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Black eye, Meredith.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Will someone please explain what's going on here? Since the interesting thing happened til now, so much time has passed, it's like my life is buffering.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Here's what happened. Pam and I were arriving for the day. And there was a gang in the parking lot on bikes, on, on motorcycles. And they were just hassling Pam...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That's true.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: They had, uh... weapons.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Weapons.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I just stepped in to talk some sense into them.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: But these were not the kind of people who use their words.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Punches were going, and I ducked a few, landed a couple, and I was fighting them off. It was totally, like, like, senseless crime.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thank goodness he was there.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Good job Andy.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah [all murmuring]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I didn't do anything any of you wouldn't have done.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Open the gates! There's plenty for everyone. No need to panic. There's plenty for everyone!

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.text: Quit it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: There's plenty. Don't stampede. No need to stampede, sir.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I was ahead of you!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, okay. Hey, hey. It's gonna be fine. It's gonna be fine. There's plenty of Pyramids.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Come on. I was in line before you.

quotes.speaker: Cathy
quotes.text: So you're a blogger right?

quotes.speaker: Blogger
quotes.text: Yeah. Blogger.

quotes.speaker: Cathy
quotes.text: God, stay away. Oh, I always get in trouble around bloggers. I'm trying to be a good girl for once.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Uh yeah. I already bought my Pyramid, but I don't want to leave yet. I haven't had so much fun since seeing... zoo-Ey Desh-channel at the Couch-arilla music festival. So fun.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: How can we feel safe knowing that there are gangs here? We should call the police right now!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No, no, no, no, no, we don't need to call the police. They'll just ask everybody questions, get up in everyone's business, right, Pam?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Police are a hassle. We settled this on the street.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: And my eye will heal. But if the police come, then we will forever stain our neighborhood as a troubled area.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Why would you care what the police think of our neighborhood?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Because I have neighborhood Pride. 1-8-5-0-5.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Guys, guys. That's so vague. You gotta do the zip plus four. 1-8-5-0-5 dash 7-4-2-7.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Look, I don't feel safe. I think we should call the police.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Exactly. We need to feel safe, which is why... Toby is giving us self defense training.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Me?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Right Toby? Will you teach us self defense?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yeah, um... I can't believe you remembered. I do self-defense. Um, I'll go put on my cup.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Great.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Blogger
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: I wasn't really sure which one of you is Chuck.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [on phone] Yeah, no, it seems to be going great. Andy got beat up by a fifth grade girl?

quotes.speaker: Blogger
quotes.text: Look at that guy. He's got his Sabre phone on, and he's not even using it.

quotes.speaker: Blogger #2
quotes.text: This is a perfect photo for my Daily Fail blog.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh, I - I gotta go. Okay.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Dwight, what is a fail? That sounds bad.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, no, no, no. It's good. It's really -- on the Internet, it's a really -- that's a really good, good, thing.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Are you trying to sabotage this entire event?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm very sorry.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: We gave you an Arrowhead for free for the day. How hard would it have been to do this, hmmm? "Hello. Hi sweetie. It's Jim. I'm calling you from the new Arrowhead, which is why my voice is crystal clear. And my hand will never get tired because of the ergonomic shape."

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm really sorry. Is there anything I can do, maybe pretend to be Chuck?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You could have pretended to be Chuck. I begged you to pretend to be Chuck, but you chose to be yourself, and you can no longer be Chuck!  Surrender the tripack. You know what you have to do.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Point it towards the store, idiot!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [laughs] You know what I mean? One of these buttons is -- damn it. Take over.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh hey, Hey, hey, you guys, you must be lost. Listen. Excuse me, sir. Yeah, the fountain where you can feed the pigeons is out behind the bank. Tell your great-grandson to bring his kid by. Okay. So long. Here we go. Erin! Psst! Come on! The elderly suck the life out of the young. Get them out of here!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: We are closed! Come on.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Self-defense is not some fun boxing match, okay? This is about escaping with your life. So... strike, scream, and run. All right? Let's try it.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: [smacks Meredith's head] [screams] [runs out]

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Ow.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: That may have been my fault.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: What the hell, Toby?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Okay, look, in a real crisis situation, you're not gonna have to time to think, okay? So just remember, I-A-A-T-G. "It's all about the groin."

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What if you're being attacked by a ... smallish man who happens to not have a groin?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I don't think that's very common.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What if you're being attacked by a 4'11" man who is penisless?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Why are you fixated on this hypothetical transgendered attacker?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Why don't we start with the basics? Show us how to defend ourselves against a baby, and then like, a fifth grade girl, and then, you know, if we have time, on up to a scary man.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Well, the most common scenario is a larger man attacking a smaller female.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: So in that scenario, what if the victim sucker-punches the attacker in the face? What can the attacker then do to better protect himself?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: It's interesting that you're drawn to the point of view of the attacker.  You would like the turn of the table. Okay, the latest Chad Flenderman novel... [everyone groans] written from the point of view of his nemesis, Dr. Lucifer Wu.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Can I please leave? I have a rape flute.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: All right, well, let's try one simple technique together. Okay, why doesn't everyone stand? Okay, so... you're being attacked. You've got your hands up. Simple palm strike to the chin. Up to the chin. One, two.

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.text: One, two.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [softly] Take that, kid.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Cathy, I would like to introduce you to Fatty Gruesome. He is a freelancer for Wired magazine.

quotes.speaker: Lady Blogger
quotes.text: Patty Grossman. I'm a woman.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: But you still work for Wired, right?

quotes.speaker: Patty
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Good! Okay. Flirt away.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Sabre. It's time to come home.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. Yeah, I mean, I think ...it seemed like you were a little nervous.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah, no [bleep], Sherlock! Can somebody please tell me something encouraging about this presentation before I go out there in front of a million people and do it?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay. I know, I know, champ. Calm down, just listen.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You know what?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You just need to realize that so much rides on this. You have no idea.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm trying to make him feel important.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: God. I wish Kelly were here. She always knew what to say.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Um... [imitating Kelly] Oh, Ryan, you're so smart. You're smarter than Mark Zuckerberg and those Google guys all combined. Hee hee hee.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You're so ignorant. You barely know what you're talking about. That is so ridiculous. You really need to read a couple books.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What's a book? [giggles]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: On my God. You're so embarrassing.  My mom would say the best stuff, though.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [ahem] You can... [slightly effeminate] You can do it Ryan.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: And you know that I'm capable of this.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You're the only one who can do it, s-sweetie.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: What did you think of the presentation?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I thought it was great, sweetie. I would just fix that one --

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Oh! "Fix" means you hate it! I knew it! I need something to drink!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim, get him a water.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: No, not a water. A sports drink. I hate everything in that fridge. Not red! Get me something yellow or green from a nearby store. Not red!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Why are you just standing there? Go to a nearby store and get him a yellow or green sports drink!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Now, if your attacker is willing to defile a corpse, you better stop playing dead right away and just make it known that you're alive.

quotes.speaker: Lady
quotes.text: Forgive me for interrupting. I believe my daughter had an altercation with somebody here, some fancy gentleman with a squeaky voice?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [deep voice] I think you guys might have the wrong Office.

quotes.speaker: Girl
quotes.text: That's him... the guy I hit.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: You've gotta be kidding me.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Poor Andy! First you got beat up by a gang, and now she kicks your ass?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: No, Kevin -- [sighs]

quotes.speaker: Lady
quotes.text: What about the lady you hit with the pine cone?

quotes.speaker: Girl
quotes.text: There. That chubby one.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I just had a baby.

quotes.speaker: Girl
quotes.text: Yesterday?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Lady
quotes.text: Apologize.

quotes.speaker: Girl
quotes.text: Sorry I kicked your ass in front of your "thin" girlfriend.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: How 'bout we wait til next year after you have your kid?

quotes.speaker: Lady
quotes.text: You know what? Tiffy's going to college.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [deep voice] Listen, I don't know what you guys are talking about, but I guess I'll just accept your apology so we can get on with our day.

quotes.speaker: Lady
quotes.text: God bless. Friend of mine uses your paper. You do good work. Bye bye.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Bye.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: So, Toby, I think we should do a different self-defense seminar -- "How to protect ourselves against tiny little girls."

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: There's no shame in getting beaten up by a girl. My ex-wife used to demolish me.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: No, there is shame in it, okay? We have to draw the line somewhere.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Oh my God, I think I see the imprint of a ring pop.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh... [Kelly laughing]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Have you seen Erin?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I'm on break.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh God...  Hey no! Where do you think you're going? You've gotta stay for the big presentation we've got this young wiz kid -- Ryan. He's like an even more handsome Bill Gates.

quotes.speaker: Blogger
quotes.text: When's the presentation?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's moments away. Just stay here!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [on phone] Hey Uncle Lucas, it's your nephew Ryan. Honestly, I could use a prescription for ritalin right now. Well, I know you did one for Aunt Carol. Oh, so it's different because it's your wife?  Well, that doesn't make any sense to me.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: How you doing?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Don't talk to me right now. I'm sorry. I- I know you're my boss, but seriously, you need to get the hell out of my face. What I don't understand is... [voice fades]

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: [to Dwight] Your little man is unraveling. Now go and fix it.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Sorry about kicking you out. It's just, we don't want our brand associated with death.

quotes.speaker: Old Lady
quotes.text: It's okay. I'll go to the Costco and search for handsome men.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: You're not married yet?

quotes.speaker: Old Lady
quotes.text: [laughs] Oh, I was. My husband was my best friend. He passed away.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: My best friend was my boss, Andy. We dated for a while, but since then, he rejected me, and we're not really friends.

quotes.speaker: Old Lady
quotes.text: Someone rejected you? With that body and those bazongas? Forget him!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yeah! Forget him! And you should forget your husband.

quotes.speaker: Old Lady
quotes.text: Well...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: How long has he been in the bathroom?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: About ten minutes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jeez! What's he doing in there? [cell phone vibrates]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oops, that's my phone. Am I allowed to answer it or are you gonna freak out?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Are there any bloggers around?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It's Ryan. "I'm sorry. I lied. I'm not in the bathroom. I can't do it. I need to see my mom. I'm going home."

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: What is the delay here? Where's Ryan? Why is he not here?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I had to send him home. As brilliant and creative as he is, he is nothing... compared to this guy!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh...

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That's right. Will you just give us a second?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: You are gonna bloody ruin it. You're gonna bloody ruin it because you're a no-good half-assed cock-eyed...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: okay.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: That's....

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim --

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm not doing the Presentation.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Look at me. Look at me! Look... at... this... face. This is not the face of a performer. This is the face of a scary apparition you see before you die. I'm telling you... if you don't do this, [whispers] I don't stand a chance. Please, Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, I'll do it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, my God. O... Kay! Go get into Ryan's costume and check out his notes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: A costume?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Of course there's a costume! [laughs]  Oh, this is gonna be great. There's nothing like some last-minutes changes to really energize a presentation.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Did you pass out in there? What is taking so long?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I've been in here for 20 seconds.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hurry up. Let me in. I wanna watch you get dressed. Did you find the eyeliner?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm not wearing eyeliner.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You are wearing eyeliner, Jim.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Coldplay's Clocks]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Time. Space. Gender. [Dwight mouthing words] There are no rules anymore. All boundaries are breaking down in the wake of the infinite future. The only thing that -- the only thing that remain -- the only thing that remains are the things that have stood the test of time -- love, values, and of course, the pyramids -- the strongest shape ever constructed, a shape that fits all other shapes inside of it. [softly] No, that's --

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's true.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: This... is the future, because... This is the past. I've been through a lot of issues in my life. I've seen drug addiction -- unemployment. I've been in a relationship that tore my heart apart, without ever being able to accept that love drove the pain. [scattered applause]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: When I was ten years old, my parents took me to Disney world. I cried the whole time. I was not able to comprehend the beauty that was before me.  I just wanted... to go home.  This is what the Pyramid will do for you. It is the bridge to the world. It has a usb port. Wireless... will be available in 2013.  You can play Anything from Chuck to Cars 2. With the Pyramid, you have the connection to everything -- in time... and space.

quotes.speaker: Crowd
quotes.text: ahhhhhh

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Psst.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [image on Pyramid] Sabre... It's time... to come home.

quotes.speaker: Crowd
quotes.text: [applause]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right.  Thank you so much. Wow. Wow! And good night! [applause continues]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah.  Thank you. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Okay, this isn't over. Let's stay focused, okay?  We made fun of Andy earlier for getting beat up by a little girl, but... little things can be dangerous.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Whether it's a gremlin or chucky the doll. The key is to throw it in something. Like a fireplace, or a tub of electricity.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Okay. Good point...

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Good point? What is a tub of electricity?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I don't... I don't...

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: With all due respect we know what we're defending against: a twelve year old female bully.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I was a twelve year old bully.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Great! I think Kelly should attack Toby.

quotes.speaker: Others
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Yeah, that's not a bad idea, actually, because I have had a lot of pent up aggression.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Good. Let's go.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I don't know if this is gonna help...Uh...

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Let's go Kelly.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: We should stay to maybe some more traditional models...

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: You think you're so pretty!  Well you're not gonna be so pretty come Prom time!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Okay, this is what's called pre-violent posturing.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Take that!  Not so pre-violent anymore!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Okay, I'm at what's called "the decision point."

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey, hey, hey. Kelly Kelly, Kelly... come on.... Ow! God! My good eye!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [laughs] Oh boy. Oh no, I'm not laughing at you. I'm laughing at, um, something that Cece did on the playground earlier -- yesterday. This morning.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You know why I got hit by girls? Because I stood up for others. Pam and for Toby.  I stepped in and I didn't care that I was standing up to girls. You may wanna ask yourselves, "Where were you when the girls came?"

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Tough day. Yes. But I feel good. I put the office in their place, took a bunch of pain killers, drank a half a bottle of wine, took my pants off.  I just feel good!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, okay, I will be the first to admit it.  We could have integrated more Chuck into the Presentation.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Dwight.  You're the vice president.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ha, ha, ha, ha! Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: [squealing]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay! Come on!

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: aagh!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hah! Yah! [kicking and punching the air] Boom!
